translated: 7Here is the corrected and aligned text:ğŸ”½MahÄprajÃ±ÄpÄramitÄ-sÅ«tra, Scroll 17
Translated by Tripiá¹­aka Master Xuanzang on Imperial Order
Chapter 7, Section 7: The First Part, the Chapter on Instructing and Guiding
Furthermore, SubhÅ«ti!
What do you see in your statement:

The suchness of the Joyous Ground is not a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, the suchness of the Stainless Ground, the Ground of Radiance, the Ground of Flaming Wisdom, the Ground of Difficult to Conquer, the Ground of Direct Presence, the Ground of Far-going, the Ground of Immovability, the Ground of Excellent Wisdom, and the Ground of Cloud of Dharma is not a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;

The suchness of the Joyous Ground is different from a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, the suchness of the Stainless Ground up to the Ground of Cloud of Dharma is different from a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;ğŸ”½Within the suchness of the Joyous Ground there is no bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, within the suchness of the Stainless Ground up to the Ground of Cloud of Dharma there is no bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;
Within a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva there is no suchness of the Joyous Ground, within a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva there is no suchness of the Stainless Ground up to the Ground of Cloud of Dharma;

Is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva separate from the true nature of the ground of extreme joy? Is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva separate from the true nature of the ground of being stainless up to the ground of the cloud of Dharma?
The venerable SubhÅ«ti said:
World-honored One,

if the ground of extreme joy and the ground of being stainless up to the ground of the cloud of Dharma are ultimately non-apprehensible because their nature does not exist, how much more so is the true nature of the ground of extreme joy and the true nature of the ground of being stainless up to the ground of the cloud of Dharma!

Since this true nature does not exist, how can one say:ğŸ”½that the true nature of the ground of extreme joy is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, and the true nature of the ground of being stainless up to the ground of the cloud of Dharma is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;

that what is other than the true nature of the ground of extreme joy is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, and what is other than the true nature of the ground of being stainless up to the ground of the cloud of Dharma is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;

In the suchness of the ground of extreme joy there is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, in the suchness of the ground of being free from defilements up to the ground of the cloud of Dharma there is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;ğŸ”½In a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva there is the suchness of the ground of extreme joy, in a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva there is the suchness of the ground of being free from defilements up to the ground of the cloud of Dharma;

Apart from the suchness of the ground of extreme joy there is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, apart from the suchness of the ground of being free from defilements up to the ground of the cloud of Dharma there is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva?
Furthermore, SubhÅ«ti!

What meaning do you see in saying:ğŸ”½The suchness of the five eyes is not a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, the suchness of the six supernormal knowledges is not a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;ğŸ”½The suchness that is different from the five eyes is not a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, the suchness that is different from the six supernormal knowledges is not a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;
In the suchness of the five eyes there is no bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, in the suchness of the six supernormal knowledges there is no bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;
It is not that within the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva there is the suchness of the five eyes, nor is it that within the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva there is the suchness of the six supernormal knowledges;
it is not that apart from the suchness of the five eyes there is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, nor is it that apart from the suchness of the six supernormal knowledges there is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva?
The venerable SubhÅ«ti said:
World-honored One!

If the five eyes and the six supernormal knowledges are ultimately non-apprehensible because their nature does not exist, how much more so for the suchness of the five eyes and the suchness of the six supernormal knowledges!

Since this suchness does not exist, how could one say:ğŸ”½that the suchness of the five eyes is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, that the suchness of the six supernormal knowledges is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;ğŸ”½that apart from the suchness of the five eyes there is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, that apart from the suchness of the six supernormal knowledges there is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;
that within the suchness of the five eyes there is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, that within the suchness of the six supernormal knowledges there is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;
There is the suchness of the five eyes within the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, there is the suchness of the six supernormal knowledges within the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;
Apart from the suchness of the five eyes there is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, apart from the suchness of the six supernormal knowledges there is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva?
Furthermore, SubhÅ«ti!

What meaning do you see in saying:ğŸ”½The suchness of the ten powers of a buddha is not a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, the suchness of the four forms of fearlessness, the four forms of unobstructed understanding, and the eighteen distinctive abilities of a buddha is not a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;ğŸ”½The suchness of the ten powers of a buddha is different from a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, the suchness of the four forms of fearlessness, the four forms of unobstructed understanding, and the eighteen distinctive abilities of a buddha is different from a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;

Within the suchness of the ten powers of a buddha there is no bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, within the suchness of the four forms of fearlessness, the four forms of unobstructed understanding, and the eighteen distinctive abilities of a buddha there is no bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;

The true nature of the ten powers of the Buddha is not a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, and the true nature of the four fearlessnesses, four unobstructed understandings, and eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha is not a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;

apart from the true nature of the ten powers of the Buddha, there is no bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, and apart from the true nature of the four fearlessnesses, four unobstructed understandings, and eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha, there is no bodhisattva-mahÄsattva?
The venerable SubhÅ«ti said:
World-Honored One!

If the ten powers of the Buddha, the four fearlessnesses, four unobstructed understandings, and eighteen distinctive abilities are ultimately non-existent, because their nature is non-existent, how much more so the true nature of the ten powers of the Buddha, and the true nature of the four fearlessnesses, four unobstructed understandings, and eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha!
Since this true nature does not exist, how can one say:

The suchness of the ten powers of a buddha is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, the suchness of the four fearlessnesses, four unobstructed understandings, and eighteen distinctive abilities of a buddha is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;

The suchness of the ten powers of a buddha is different from the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, the suchness of the four fearlessnesses, four unobstructed understandings, and eighteen distinctive abilities of a buddha is different from the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;ğŸ”½Within the suchness of the ten powers of a buddha there is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, within the suchness of the four fearlessnesses, four unobstructed understandings, and eighteen distinctive abilities of a buddha there is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;

Within the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva there is the suchness of the ten powers of a buddha, within the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva there is the suchness of the four fearlessnesses, four unobstructed understandings, and eighteen distinctive abilities of a buddha;

Is there a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva apart from the suchness of the ten powers of a buddha, is there a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva apart from the suchness of the four fearlessnesses, four unobstructed understandings, and eighteen distinctive abilities of a buddha?
Furthermore, SubhÅ«ti!
What do you see in meaning to say:
the suchness of great kindness is not a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, the suchness of great compassion, great joy, and great equanimity is not a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;

the suchness of great kindness is different from a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, the suchness of great compassion, great joy, and great equanimity is different from a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;ğŸ”½within the suchness of great kindness there is no bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, within the suchness of great compassion, great joy, and great equanimity there is no bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;
within a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva there is no suchness of great kindness, within a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva there is no suchness of great compassion, great joy, and great equanimity;

apart from the suchness of great kindness there is no bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, apart from the suchness of great compassion, great joy, and great equanimity there is no bodhisattva-mahÄsattva?ğŸ”½The venerable SubhÅ«ti said:
World-Honored One!

If great kindness, great compassion, great joy, and great equanimity are ultimately non-existent, because their nature does not exist, how much more so for the true suchness of great kindness and the true suchness of great compassion, great joy, and great equanimity!
Since this true suchness does not exist, how can one say:
The true suchness of great kindness is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, the true suchness of great compassion, great joy, and great equanimity is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;

Different from the true suchness of great kindness is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, different from the true suchness of great compassion, great joy, and great equanimity is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;ğŸ”½Within the true suchness of great kindness there is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, within the true suchness of great compassion, great joy, and great equanimity there is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;
Within the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva there is the true suchness of great kindness, within the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva there is the true suchness of great compassion, great joy, and great equanimity;
Is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva separate from the true nature of great loving-kindness? Is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva separate from the true nature of great compassion, great joy, and great equanimity?
Furthermore, SubhÅ«ti!
What meaning do you see in saying:
The true nature of the thirty-two major marks is not a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, the true nature of the eighty minor marks is not a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;

The true nature that is different from the thirty-two major marks is not a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, the true nature that is different from the eighty minor marks is not a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;ğŸ”½Within the true nature of the thirty-two major marks there is no bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, within the true nature of the eighty minor marks there is no bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;
Within a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva there is no true nature of the thirty-two major marks, within a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva there is no true nature of the eighty minor marks;
Is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva separate from the suchness of the thirty-two major marks, or separate from the suchness of the eighty minor marks?
The venerable SubhÅ«ti said:
World-honored One!

If the thirty-two major marks and the eighty minor marks are ultimately non-apprehensible, because their nature does not exist, how much more so the suchness of the thirty-two major marks and the suchness of the eighty minor marks!

Since this suchness does not exist, how can one say:ğŸ”½That the suchness of the thirty-two major marks is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, and the suchness of the eighty minor marks is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;ğŸ”½That apart from the suchness of the thirty-two major marks is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, and apart from the suchness of the eighty minor marks is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;
That within the suchness of the thirty-two major marks is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, and within the suchness of the eighty minor marks is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;
The true nature of the thirty-two major marks of a great man within the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, the true nature of the eighty minor marks within the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;
Apart from the true nature of the thirty-two major marks of a great man, there is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva; apart from the true nature of the eighty minor marks, there is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva?
Furthermore, SubhÅ«ti!
What meaning do you see in saying:
The true nature of the factor of retention is not a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, the true nature of the factor of abiding in equanimity is not a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;

Other than the true nature of the factor of retention is not a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, other than the true nature of the factor of abiding in equanimity is not a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;ğŸ”½Within the true nature of the factor of retention there is no bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, within the true nature of the factor of abiding in equanimity there is no bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;
Within the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva there is no true nature of the factor of retention, within the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva there is no true nature of the factor of abiding in equanimity;
Is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva not separate from the true nature of non-forgetfulness, and is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva not separate from the true nature of constant abiding in equanimity?
The venerable SubhÅ«ti said:
World-honored One!

If non-forgetfulness and constant abiding in equanimity are ultimately non-apprehensible because of the non-existence of their natures, how much more so for the true nature of non-forgetfulness and the true nature of constant abiding in equanimity!

Since this true nature does not exist, how can one say:ğŸ”½That the true nature of non-forgetfulness is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, and the true nature of constant abiding in equanimity is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;ğŸ”½That apart from the true nature of non-forgetfulness there is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, and apart from the true nature of constant abiding in equanimity there is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;
That within the true nature of non-forgetfulness there is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, and within the true nature of constant abiding in equanimity there is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;

the true nature of the power of recollection within the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, the true nature of the power of non-forgetfulness within the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, the true nature of the power of concentration within the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, the true nature of the power of wisdom within the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, the true nature of the power of liberation within the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, the true nature of the power of turning the wheel of the Dharma within the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;

apart from the true nature of the power of recollection there is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, apart from the true nature of the power of non-forgetfulness there is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, apart from the true nature of the power of concentration there is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, apart from the true nature of the power of wisdom there is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, apart from the true nature of the power of liberation there is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, apart from the true nature of the power of turning the wheel of the Dharma there is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva?
Furthermore, SubhÅ«ti!

What meaning do you see in saying:ğŸ”½the true nature of the knowledge of all modes is not a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, the true nature of the knowledge of path aspects and the knowledge of all aspects is not a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;ğŸ”½apart from the true nature of the knowledge of all modes there is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, apart from the true nature of the knowledge of path aspects and the knowledge of all aspects there is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;

within the true nature of the knowledge of all modes there is no bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, within the true nature of the knowledge of path aspects and the knowledge of all aspects there is no bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;

It is not that within the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva there is the suchness of the knowledge of all modes, nor is it that within the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva there is the suchness of the knowledge of path aspects and the knowledge of all aspects;

It is not that apart from the suchness of the knowledge of all modes there is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, nor is it that apart from the suchness of the knowledge of path aspects and the knowledge of all aspects there is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva.
The venerable SubhÅ«ti said:
World-honored One,

if the knowledge of all modes, the knowledge of path aspects, and the knowledge of all aspects are ultimately non-apprehensible because their nature does not exist, how much more so is the suchness of the knowledge of all modes and the suchness of the knowledge of path aspects and the knowledge of all aspects!
Since this suchness does not exist, how can one say:
that the suchness of the knowledge of all modes is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, and that the suchness of the knowledge of path aspects and the knowledge of all aspects is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva?
The suchness of the cognition of the path and the cognition of all aspects is not a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;ğŸ”½

The suchness of the cognition of the path and the cognition of all aspects is not a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;ğŸ”½the suchness of the cognition of all aspects is not a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva.ğŸ”½Within the suchness of the cognition of all aspects there is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;ğŸ”½within a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva there is the suchness of the cognition of all aspects.ğŸ”½Apart from the suchness of the cognition of all aspects there is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva;
apart from a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva there is the suchness of the cognition of all aspects?
World-Honored One!

Since form and other dharmas and suchness cannot be apprehended, it is impossible to say that form and other dharmas are the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, or that something other than the suchness of form and other dharmas is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, or that within the suchness of form and other dharmas there is the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva, or that within the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva there is the suchness of form and other dharmas, or that apart from the suchness of form and other dharmas there is a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva.
The Buddha told SubhÅ«ti:ğŸ”½Excellent!
Excellent!
It is just as you have said.
SubhÅ«ti!

Since form and other dharmas cannot be apprehended, the suchness of form and other dharmas also cannot be apprehended. Since dharmas and suchness cannot be apprehended, the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva also cannot be apprehended. Since the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva cannot be apprehended, the prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ that is practiced is also unapprehendable.
SubhÅ«ti!
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practicing prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ should study in this way.
Furthermore, SubhÅ«ti,

No, Blessed One!
Blessed One!

No, World-Honored One.
World-Honored One.

World-Honored One.

World-Honored One.

World-Honored One.

World-Honored One.

Blessed One!

No they are not, Blessed One!
